title: Is Pro Wrestling’s Boom Too Good to Believe?
text:
This business was on the ropes. It still is, but in a good way.

With its blend of scripted entertainment, live action, streaming-friendly content, merchandise sales and relatively young fans, fake wrestling has made investors real money. Shares of publicly traded market leader World Wrestling Entertainment were a steal back in early 2015, though, plunging close to $10 following a loss-making year and a disappointing television-rights contract. They briefly topped $100 this spring on optimism over new five-year deals with Comcast...
description: Even though fake fights are making real money, industry leader WWE might be vulnerable as it kicks off a lucrative TV contract.
